course_title: Anthropology; Special Topics: Global Peace and Conflict
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 100 / Seats Avail: 47Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: Instructor = Dr. Sa'ed Atshan.  This course will explore anthropological and interdisciplinary scholarship on peace, conflict, social movements, human rights, and humanitarianism. Our scope will be global, considering ethnographic case studies from around the world including Africa, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, and South America. Open to students of all backgrounds.
course_description: Seminar or lecture series on topics of anthropological interest at an intermediate level. Maybe repeated for credit when topic varies.
schedule_location: TTh 2:30pm-3:45pm in Math & Science Center - E208
sections: Class Nbr: 5191, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: Atshan/Habib, Status: Open
